summary:
I am a scientist working on sustainable chains with the two focus areas:
•	Identifying and studying sustainable biobased and circular chains
•	Quantifying and optimising sustainability performance during early design stages of (process) chains.

Core of my expertise is developing simulation and optimisation models that quantitatively address the sustainability performance. In such models principles from operations management systems analysis, process engineering, and sustainability analysis (e.g. LCA) are combined. My research interest is for, but not limited to, the research fields biobased economy, biotechnology, and circular chains.
Publications can be found at: https://research.wur.nl/en/persons/ellen-slegers/publications/ 

Next to research I have a passion for teaching, either by supervising students during their thesis research or by developing and teaching courses related to Sustainability Analysis.

Experienced user of software programs Matlab, SimaPro, AIMMS, eSankey and Mathcad. Experience with GAMS, ArcGIS and SuperProDesigner

projects:
[{'title': '7th FrameWork Program MIRACLES', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'MIRACLES is an industry-driven R&D and innovation project aimed at developing integrated, multiple-product biorefinery technologies for the production of specialties from microalgae for application in food, aquaculture and non-food products.

Tasks involved in: 
◦To generate conceptual biorefinery design models for techno-economic and sustainability assessment 
◦To assess the economics and sustainability of the biorefinery concepts and value chain, employing techno-economic evaluation, state-of-the-art Life Cycle assessment methodology, and socio-economic assessment
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ellen', 'last_name': 'Slegers', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Assistant Professor at Wageningen University'}]}, {'title': 'AlgaePARC Biorefinery', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Aim: develop innovative, scalable technologies for biorefinery of commodities (lipids, proteins, carbohydrates) from microalgae

Tasks: Systems Analysis and sustainability assessment
The aim of this work is to perform Life Cycle Assessment driven design of integral algae biorefineries including processing conditions and product routing and resource recovery based on input of data by the project partners. Furthermore the work will address integration of the algae biorefinery within the supply chain.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ellen', 'last_name': 'Slegers', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Assistant Professor at Wageningen University'}]}, {'title': 'BeWhere Algae', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'BeWhere Algae is a long running project aiming at developing and extending a logistic model to 
-geographical siting of algae plants, 
-allocation of resources,
-cost/energy/LCA evaluation of large scale algae production

Project is a cooperation of Wageningen University (Ellen Slegers) and IIASA (BeWhere team at ESM group)', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ellen', 'last_name': 'Slegers', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Assistant Professor at Wageningen University'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'sylvain leduc', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'New course Sustainability Analysis', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Developing new course on Sustainability Analysis. -accomodation in study programmes Biosystems Engineering and Biotechnology
-development of course materials (lectures, reader, exercises, case studies)
-organisation of lecture team
-examinor
